newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page - Dec 11.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page - Dec 11.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following stories on its front page Wednesday:
- NATO took its first formal step toward expanding its alliance to include Eastern European nations that were once Communist.
- Opposition is gathering among educational and parent groups to the ratings system about to be proposed by the television industry.
- Beth Israel Medical Center and St. Luke's-Roosevelt Hospital Center, both of New York City, said they'll form a single parent corporation to oversee both hospitals.
- High Wall Street profits are bringing in so much tax revenue that New York City may end its fiscal year with a surplus of nearly $350 million.
- The Clinton administration tightened wetlands regulations.
- New York City Council leaders said they would defeat Mayor Rudolph Giuliani's proposal for making it easier for superstores to open in the city.
- Psychoanalysts in Russia are shaking free of 70 years of drug-based Soviet psychiatry to once again explore Freudian concempts.
